title: Cathy Autumn's Author Page
content:
=====
[[include component:preview
text=
My author page has a preview. Do you know who doesn't have a preview on their author page? Djkaktus.
]]
=====

[[include :scp-wiki:theme:scp-trans-pride |trans-pride-logo= --] |trans-pride-footer= --]]]

[[module CSS]]

  display: none;

[[>]]

[[tabview]]

[[tab About me]]

[[include component:image-block name=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/4/45/Woman_in_a_shirt_in_woods_%28Unsplash%29.jpg|caption=Me? Nope.]]

Testing, testing. Is this thing on? The rain in Spain falls mainly on the plain. She sells seashells by the seashore. Six sticky skeletons. Hippo. Greek grapes. I'm just fucking with you.

Hello world! I'm Cathy Autumn, your friendly neighborhood author. I don't know who in the world fucked up badly enough to allow me onto the website, but it's too late now! You're suck with me for ever and ever.

A few facts about myself:
* [REDACTED]
* [REDACTED]
* [REDACTED]
* Pronouns are She/It;
* If you couldn't guess from the fact that literally all of my pages use the Trans Pride theme, I'm Trans! If you have a problem with that, then how do I say this politely... **//go fuck yourself//**;
* Horror and weird fiction nerd;
* Massive TMA[[footnote]]The Magnus Archives is a podcast distributed by Rusty Quill and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License[[/footnote]] fan;

I think that's everything!
[[/tab]]

[[tab SCPs]]

**[[[SCP-7845]]] -- //[[[SCP-7845|Two Ships Passing In The Night]]]//**
@@    @@//Researcher Chen reported an undefined feeling of sadness and loneliness that persisted throughout the day.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-7845"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

My first article. It was meant to be a simple mystery and romance. The fact that this has stayed on truly shocked me.

**Associated TMA Entity:**[[footnote]]//Totally// didn't steal this idea from UraniumEmpire! Right? Right?[[/footnote]] The Lonely
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-7846]]] -- //[[[SCP-7846|A Stage Illuminated Only By Ghost Light]]]//**
@@    @@//The audience sits passively. There is a moment of silence. The performer begins their monologue.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-7846"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

This article is secretly a vent piece about how much I hated being forced to join the Drama Club.

Also, ghost light is a theater term meaning an electric light that is left energized on the stage of a theatre when the theatre is unoccupied and would otherwise be completely dark.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Stranger
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8413]]] -- //[[[SCP-8413|Ashes to Ashes, Dust to Dust, 9 to 5]]]//**
@@    @@//The previous description (Revision #023) was denied due to including a number of disputed terms. At issue are the words "judgement", "justice", "punishment", and "thematic".//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8413"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

I really, //really//, hate my job, so I wrote a story about it. My first foray into body horror.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Flesh

[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8047]]] -- //[[[SCP-8047|Writhing, Squirming, Living]]]//**
@@    @@//You're gonna live another day. You're just not going to like how.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8047"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

To me, the Fire Suppression Department is at its most interesting when they're working behind the scenes and they aren't doing anything directly awful. Torturing or threatening your employees is lame. Gaslight them instead.

Also, I hate worms.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Corruption
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8169]]] -- //[[[SCP-8169|Arachnophilia]]]//**
@@    @@//Large clumps of web have been discovered within the menstrual blood of SCP-8169-A instances.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8169"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

**Warning:** This story contains sexual themes and extreme body horror. It was written primary to inspire disgust and horror.

This story made three of my IRL friends angry at me and lose their appetites. I count that as a success.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Web
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8869]]] -- //[[[SCP-8869|Rhizomatic Murder Victims]]]//**
@@    @@//To kill for entertainment is harmless.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8869"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

Cowritten with FLOORBOARDS and MisterFrown.

A spiritual remix of SCP-7413. (To make it clear for people with 0 reading comprehension: I was never broken up with and don't want to kill people.)

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Beholding
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8176|SCP-276-ARC]]] -- //[[[SCP-8176|Foundation of '76]]]//**
@@    @@//SCP-276 designates the remains of the five members of the Kirk Lonwood Choir Club of 1976.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8176"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

No, this isn't a Series I SCP. 

Instead it's a Delta Green-inspired SCP of just how messed up and badly organized the 70s Foundation was. Featuring a beloved old Author Avatar (I make him racist.)

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Slaughter
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8091]]] -- //[[[SCP-8091|Pyrophobia: Burn With Me]]]//**
@@    @@//The subject must be entirely consumed by the conflagration.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8091"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

Written for Anthology 2024. It didn’t do as well as I hoped, but I got a fucking Volgun video out of it, so….

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Desolation

[[/collapsible]]

**[[[SCP-8071]]] -- //[[[SCP-8071|Leave Me In Misery]]]//**
@@    @@//On 10/12/2020, the SCP-8071 Research Team made a breakthrough in stable and affordable containment of the anomaly.//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="scp-8071"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

Written about a person I know. Also the Trash fire canon, which is the best on the site. Fight me.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Spiral
[[/collapsible]]

[[/tab]]

[[tab Tales/GoI Formats/Other]]

**[[[One More Tomorrow]]] -- //[[[one-more-tomorrow|Vignettes From A World Under Pizzicato]]]//**
@@    @@//Where everything isn't meant to be okay // In television dreams of tomorrow//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="one-more-tomorrow"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

Cowritten with a fuck ton of people.

A work for the 8000 Dead Rats Canon.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Extinction
[[/collapsible]]

**[[[Chronicle Of The Worm]]] -- //[[[chronicle of the worm|A Story About Power]]]//**
@@    @@//"I expect great things from you, Director Graham."//
[[collapsible show=" ► Ramblings" hide=" ▼ Close"]]
[[module ListPages name="chronicle-of-the-worm"]]
**(%%created_at%%) (+%%rating%%), Last comment by %%commented_by%%, %%commented_at%%**
[[/module]]

Written for two canons.

I want to beat Graham to death with a rock.

**Associated TMA Entity:** The Buried
[[/collapsible]]

[[/tab]]

[[tab Praise for my work]]

//But nobody came.//

[[/tab]]

[[tab Recommendations]]

These are SCPs that I wish I had written first. Some of my favorites and my recommendations for y'all to read.

[[[SCP-7324]]] by FLOORBOARDS

> **Billy Bob Brockali:** Things can’t keep going the way they are, kiddo. From here on out, there will be consequences.

[[[SCP-7804]]] by It's a bad idea

> {{All gods of the pantheon must be honored no matter how terrible. That is the will of the bells. And we must respect that. Don't forget, and good night.}}

[[[SCP-5050]]] by JackalRelated

> //"It is my decree that our new visitors should be treated with respect and kindness and not mauled, maimed, disfigured, or killed in any way possible. I will see it they get their just desserts."//

[[[SCP-2747]]] by minmin

> At no time are the properties of the //anafabula// as outlined in **Appendix B** to arise in real life, whether as a result of deliberate or natural action. Any object, person or event bearing more than significance-level α to the semblance threshold is to be altered via whatever means possible.

[[[SCP-5956]]] by HarryBlank and Placeholder MCD

> I can't live without you. But, after what I've done to you, I hope you can live without me.

[[[SCP-6223]]] by LordStoneFish

> **DJ Slimy:** I always know who I need, who I want. The subjects of my sermons are guaranteed to understand.

[[[SCP-3178]]] by UraniumEmpire

> They call it God-fearing for a reason.

[[[SCP-5657]]] by T. Rutherford

> Until testing is complete, SCP-5657's survival is considered paramount, as currently they are the only known means of detecting "Smiling Men".

[[[SCP-6445|SCP-⌘]]] by MontagueETC

> WARNING: THE FOLLOWING LIE IS A TRUTH. PLEASE INSERT DISC 2 INTO YOUR CONSOLE.

[[[SCP-5656]]] by Pedantique

> You'll see, assholes. I'll show you what happens when you stab someone in the back. You aren't the only ones with teeth to spare.

[[[SCP-8140]]] by Grigori Karpin

> They fascinate me. Rewriting history to suit their needs. Battle lost? Change it. Bad day? Do it over. I would give anything to have that power. To change just that one day.

[[[nagiros-proposal|Nagiros' Proposal: R ¦ A ¦ G ¦ E]]] by Nagiros[[footnote]]who would have guessed?[[/footnote]]

> The Edict of 2102 remains in effect: Sepulchration of Tier-Null Terra is acceptable in the pursuit of SCP-001's annihilum. There is no world worth saving but the one we have ordained.

[[[SCP-7794]]] by Cubeflix

> All the glass objects and silverware were found shattered. All the windows and exits in the home were locked. Chairs and furniture were placed over the doors, likely by the victim. The upstairs bathroom of the house was found missing.

[[[SCP-5999]]] by S D Locke, Modern_Erasmus, TheeSherm, Woedenaz, VolgunStrife

> **Discoveries:** One hundred extinguished candles, gathered in the center of the --living-- quarters.

[[[SCP-2498]]] by Minmin

> I kept on going up. And it was the same. Sky after sky. Shells and shells. Our world is wrong. We were wrong. There is no revelation, only introspection.

[[[SCP-8060]]] by Ratking666 and Monkeysky

> ##blue|**There is no such thing as darkness here.**##

[[[pickman-blank-proposal|Pickman-Blank Proposal: The Frontispiece]]] by HarryBlank and ihp

> Stop Compromising Principles.

[[[SCP-5790]]] by MaliceAforethought

> [DATA EXPUNGED] increase biological similarity between cerebrospinal fluid and holy water to lower death toll.

[[[SCP-7660]]] by A Random Day

> When you died, you dreamed of fire and metal. There was a glass window somewhere beyond your reach while you burned alive. When you lived, you met each slamhound in turn with the same pain.

[[[SCP-8994]]] by Redredred

> Her soul will be destroyed following punishment. She will not be offered a reprieve by God.

[[/tab]]

I am here

Okay, so I was called into work today and they told me about those things that happen when you do the thing, you know? Well, it was fucked up and I never want to see anything like it ever again. Also, this is dio, have a good day.
